snippet: The Pakistani government, in response to a Taliban cease-fire, suspended its airstrike campaign, but reserved the right “to effectively respond to acts of violence.”
abstract: Pakistani government suspends its airstrike campaign against militants in country's northwestern tribal regions, in response to Taliban cease-fire; actions raise prospect that peace talks between two sides will be revived.
lead_paragraph: The Pakistani government, in response to a Taliban cease-fire, suspended its airstrike campaign, but reserved the right “to effectively respond to acts of violence.”

headline.main: Taliban Move Brings Halt to Airstrikes in Pakistan
headline.print_headline: Taliban Move Brings Halt to Airstrikes
